label: p
sentence: Introduction Induction of labour is the artificial initiation of labour before its spontaneous onset for the purpose of delivery of the fetoplacental unit using mechanical or pharmacologic methods [1].

label: i
sentence: The patients were randomly allocated to either Group A, (n = 100) who received oral tablet misoprostol 50 mcg 6 hourly for maximum four doses or Group B, (n = 100) who received vaginal tablet misoprostol 50 mcg 6 hourly for maximum four doses.?

label: i
sentence: To compare the efficacy of oral with vaginal misoprostol for induction of labour.

label: i
sentence: The purpose of this study was to compare the efficacy and safety of oral versus vaginal misoprostol for induction of labour in the equivalent dosage of 50 mcg 6 hourly.?

label: o
sentence: Demographic profile, gestational age, number of doses required, induction-delivery interval, mode of delivery and feto maternal outcome was noted.?

label: o
sentence: The induction delivery interval, maternal and fetal outcome and need for augmentation of labour in these two groups were also compared.?
